Detailed Description

Base interface for all scene elements. Attributes of every node in the .avg file can be changed by accessing them through the corresponding IAVGNode interface. In addition to the node interface itself, additional cababilities may be available through IAVGVideo, IAVGWords or IAVGExcl, depending on the type of the node.

Nodes in an avg file are organized in a hierarchy, with avg and excl nodes forming groups containing image, video and word nodes.

Member Function Documentation

IAVGNode IAVGNode::getChild (  in long  i  ) 
 

Returns the ith child node.

string IAVGNode::getID (   ) 
 

Returns the unique id that can be used to reference the node.

long IAVGNode::getNumChildren (   ) 
 

If the node is a grouping node (NT_AVG or NT_EXCL), returns the number of children. If not, returns 0.

IAVGNode IAVGNode::getParent (   ) 
 

Returns the parent node, if there is one.

long IAVGNode::getType (   ) 
 

Returns one of the NT_xxx constants NT_IMAGE, NT_AVG, NT_VIDEO, NT_TEXT or NT_EXCL.

Member Data Documentation

attribute float IAVGNode::angle
 

Angle is the amount the node should be rotated in degrees. Invalid for avg and excl nodes. If pivotx and pivoty aren't set, the node is rotated around its center point.

attribute float IAVGNode::height
 

The height of the node. For bitmaps, this is immutable and should not be changed. For avg nodes, this value determines the clipping rectangle of the children.

attribute float IAVGNode::opacity
 

Opacity ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 and is relative to the parent's opacity.

attribute float IAVGNode::pivotx
 

The x coordinate of the point the node is rotated around.

attribute float IAVGNode::pivoty
 

The y coordinate of the point the node is rotated around.

attribute float IAVGNode::width
 

The width of the node. For bitmaps, this is immutable and should not be changed. For avg nodes, this value determines the clipping rectangle of the children.

attribute float IAVGNode::x
 

The x position of the node relative to its parent node. Negative values are allowed and cause the element to be clipped.

attribute float IAVGNode::y
 

The y position of the node relative to its parent node. Negative values are allowed and cause the element to be clipped.

attribute long IAVGNode::z
 

The z position of the node. This is used to determine which nodes are displayed on top of other nodes. The z value only has an effect on direct siblings. Nodes in different groups are rendered according to the z-ordering of the group nodes.
